definition.argsxml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="args_start" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><next><block type="call_procedure"><field name="procedure"></field><next><block type="entity"><field name="name">players</field><field name="type">players</field><statement name="args"><block type="item"><field name="name">item</field><statement name="args"><block type="number_min_max"><field name="name">quantity</field><field name="min">0</field><field name="max">6400</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">If the executed command contains a number parameter, we continue with this path and the procedure inside the number parameter block will be executed. As we can not give less than 0 item, we set the minimal value to 0 and the maximal to 6400 (10 stacks), like the Minecraft command.</comment><statement name="args"><block type="call_procedure"><field name="procedure"></field></block></statement><next><block type="call_procedure"><field name="procedure"></field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">If the executed command does not contain a number parameter, we will execute this procedure. When this case happens with the vanilla command, the gtame gives 1 item.</comment></block></next></block></statement><next><block type="call_procedure"><field name="procedure"></field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">When the command does not provide an item parameter, we execute another procedure to tell to the user there is a missing argument. If  nothing is done, Minecraft will simply return an error message.</comment></block></next></block></statement><next><block type="call_procedure"><field name="procedure"></field></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
